articles.title: Russian gas flows to Europe despite Putin deadline - Reuters
articles.description: Russia allowed gas to keep flowing to Europe on Friday despite a deadline for buyers to pay in roubles or be cut off, and peace talks resumed, with Moscow saying it would respond to a Ukrainian offer.

articles.title: Surging fuel and food prices send eurozone inflation to new high of 7.5% - Financial Times
articles.description: Record rate for bloc increases pressure on European Central Bank to raise interest rates
articles.content:
Consumer prices in the eurozone rose by a record 7.5 per cent in March from a year ago, piling pressure on the European Central Bank to tighten its ultra-loose monetary policy faster than planned.

articles.content:

articles.author: CNN
articles.title: Energy crisis looms as Russia doubles down on rubles-for-gas demand - 9News
articles.description: Russia has doubled down on its threat to cut off natural gas supplies to Western countries that refuse to pay in rubles, raising new concerns about an energy supply crunch and rationing in Europe.
